speaker: ANGELA
line: Ohh! I've got mosquito bites. I've got blisters. I hate those new boots.

speaker: WALLACE
line: Honey. Why are you so P.O.'d? I thought we had a good time.

speaker: ANGELA
line: You had a good time. You had a fine time tromping around and leaving me a half a mile behind. Look, for future reference, me running through the woods after you for an entire day is not my idea of a good time.

speaker: WALLACE
line: I'm sorry. I've got longer legs. I was excited, you know? The great outdoors, communing with nature.

speaker: WALLACE
line: Your head hurt?

speaker: ANGELA
line: Yeah.

speaker: WALLACE
line: You can hit me in the head with a rock if it'll make you feel better.

speaker: ANGELA
line: Fine. Go get one. I'm taking a shower.

speaker: WALLACE
line: You still mad at me?

speaker: ANGELA
line: No. I'm not mad.

speaker: WALLACE
line: Come here. So I guess we're never going hiking again. It's indoors forever from now on. Angie, honey, what's up?

speaker: ANGELA
line: Just hold me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh. Ugh. I don't know what they did with the screen for this thing. Now, this is Angela and Wallace Schiff. It's a young married couple last seen hiking in the vicinity of Brown Mountain, North Carolina. That's Angie on the right. I should add that this is the condition in which their bodies were found after being missing for only three days... in temperatures that never got above 70 degrees.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Which rules out decomposition. I'd say predation, but the... the bones would be scattered.

speaker: MULDER
line: Not to mention that these skeletons are not wearing any clothes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Right. Well, I'd say it looks like a double murder, possibly one with ritualistic overtones. The bodies may have been stripped then skeletonized, possibly by boiling or by the use of some kind of acid solution. Maybe the arrangement of the bodies has some meaning for the killer or killers. But at any rate, I'd term it "ritualistic."

speaker: MULDER
line: That's a pretty big operation you're describing. There was no evidence found at the scene-- no tire tracks, no footprints, nothing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, what do you think this is?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's Brown Mountain, Scully. That doesn't ring a bell? The Brown Mountain lights? It's a famous atmospheric phenomenon dating back nearly 700 years witnessed by thousands of people-- back to the Cherokee Indians. Strange multicolored lights are seen to dance above the peak of the mountain. There's been no geological explanation, no scientific credible explanation at all.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And what does that have to do with these two?

speaker: MULDER
line: As I said, there's been no scientific credible explanation but there are those of us who believe these strange multicolored lights are really...

speaker: SCULLY
line: UFOs. Extraterrestrial visitors from beyond who apparently have nothing better to do than buzz one mountain over and over again for 700 years.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sounds like crap when you say it. I'm just wondering if there's a connection, Scully. I mean, the conditions of these bodies are reminiscent of certain southwestern cattle mutilations. Those are cases where there's no physical evidence and they've long been associated with UFO activity.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, can't you just for once, just... for the novelty of it come up with the simplest explanation, the most logical one, instead of automatically jumping to UFOs or Bigfoot or...?

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, in six years, how... how often have I been wrong? No, seriously. I mean, every time I bring you a case we go through this perfunctory dance. You tell me I'm not being scientifically rigorous and that I'm off my nut, and then in the end who turns out to be right like 98.9% of the time? I just think I've... earned the benefit of the doubt here.

speaker: CORONER
line: We gave them adjoining suites. I was ready to send them on to Chapel Hill. Figured the state medical examiner should have a look at them.

speaker: MULDER
line: We appreciate you holding off.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The connective tissue is more or less intact.

speaker: CORONER
line: Unlike everything else. I'm not sure what to make of it considering the short time frame.

speaker: SCULLY
line: If you'll, um, pardon an obvious question are you sure that these are the right two bodies and not two others that have lain out for six months?

speaker: CORONER
line: We triple-checked the dental records. Angela and Wallace Schiff-- no doubt about it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hmm. And they were both found near Brown Mountain, right? Where exactly?

speaker: CORONER
line: Well, I could write you some directions.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Would you, uh, happen to know what this is?

speaker: CORONER
line: Well, the remains were found in a swampy area. It's some sort of organic material relating to that. It's bog sludge.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm going to check out where the bodies were found. You coming?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. You go ahead.

speaker: MULDER
line: Wallace Schiff?

speaker: MULDER
line: Wallace Schiff?

speaker: CORONER
line: We got your gas spectrometer results. That stuff on the bones I said was bog sludge? It isn't.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Water, hydrochloric acid... Electrolytes, pepsins and trypsins. It's a digestive secretion.

speaker: CORONER
line: It's stomach juices pretty much-- Pretty damn close to it... Except for this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Chitinase?

speaker: CORONER
line: It's a digestive enzyme as well but it's strictly plant, not animal.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hello!

speaker: CORONER
line: I told you, I'd seen this before. These are the two I remember anyway.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Both of these were discovered as skeletal remains.

speaker: CORONER
line: Right, but we saw nothing odd in that. Both were lost hikers found months or years later or whatever it says there.

speaker: (REPORT SAYS
line: "Victim found 2 miles southeast … Brown Mountain exit - Highway 5 …")

speaker: SCULLY
line: It says here that the bodies were found not far from where Angela and Wallace Schiff turned up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, Mulder, answer your phone.

speaker: RECORDING
line: The cellular customer you are trying...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do me a favor. I want you to forward a sample of that secretion over to the FBI lab at Quantico. I want them to run a complete analysis.

speaker: CORONER
line: You got it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And, uh, in the meantime, could I borrow your truck?

speaker: WALLACE
line: Please... don't take me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then, come out here. Step closer. I won't hurt you.

speaker: WALLACE
line: You're not one of them?

speaker: MULDER
line: One of who? Are you Wallace Schiff? Well, I hate to tell you this, Wallace, but you're supposed to be dead. They found your skeleton not 200 yards from here.

speaker: WALLACE
line: It's fake. They put it there.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who put it there?

speaker: WALLACE
line: You know who.

speaker: MULDER
line: The Brown Mountain lights.

speaker: WALLACE
line: They abducted us... me and my wife Angela. They took us on board their... oh, God.

speaker: MULDER
line: Wallace... Wallace? They found your wife Angela, too... lying right alongside your skeleton.

speaker: WALLACE
line: No. Don't you get it? They-they faked our deaths! They have that kind of technology. Who the hell would look for us if they thought they'd already found our bodies? You see? They returned me, but Angela, she's still up there... being experimented on and I-I-I-I can't... I don't know what to... what do I do?!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?!

speaker: MULDER
line: First things first-- we got to find a way out of here.

speaker: WALLACE
line: Right behind you.

speaker: MULDER
line: What the hell's going on? That was solid rock a minute ago. Now there's nothing there.

speaker: WALLACE
line: Oh, God. It's them. They're affecting your head... maybe mine, too. What if I can't even tell what's real?

speaker: MULDER
line: Wallace, let's get out of here. Come on, Wallace.

speaker: WALLACE
line: They're out there, man.

speaker: WALLACE
line: It's them!

speaker: MULDER
line: Wallace!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?! Mulder!

speaker: WALLACE
line: Don't let them see you!

speaker: MULDER
line: They're gone.

speaker: WALLACE
line: Yeah, for now. Thank God, they didn't find us.

speaker: MULDER
line: They should have. Maybe they came for something else.

speaker: WALLACE
line: Oh, my God! Oh, my God... Angie!

speaker: WALLACE
line: They brought her back.

speaker: MULDER
line: Angie, can you talk to me? Do you remember what happened? Can you tell me?

speaker: ANGELA
line: It's all fuzzy and...

speaker: MULDER
line: You were with your husband. With Wallace.

speaker: ANGELA
line: There was a light. A bright light.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where was that light coming from? From the mountain?

speaker: ANGELA
line: Over Brown Mountain. There were strange lights dancing over the peak and... and they took me. And Wallace, too.

speaker: MULDER
line: And then what happened?

speaker: ANGELA
line: Oh, just... it all went black. And when I woke up, I didn't know where I was and I couldn't see Wallace anymore.

speaker: WALLACE
line: They returned me first.

speaker: MULDER
line: This... this place that they took you to can you describe it to me tell me what it looked like?

speaker: ANGELA
line: It was white. A white place. It was featureless. I was lying on a table and I couldn't get up. I mean, nothing was holding me down but I couldn't move.

speaker: MULDER
line: Were there men there?

speaker: ANGELA
line: Yes, there were men standing over me but I couldn't see their faces.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did they perform tests on you?

speaker: ANGELA
line: Yes. They did tests. Terrible... tests. What?

speaker: MULDER
line: You have a, uh... you have a scar back here on the back of your neck.

speaker: WALLACE
line: What? What scar?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's fresh.

speaker: WALLACE
line: What is that?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's an implant. I've seen this before.

speaker: ANGELA
line: Yes. The drill-- I remember the drill. I couldn't see it at first. That was the worst part. But I could hear it spinning and it was coming out of the light... oh, what did they put in me?

speaker: WALLACE
line: Is there one in me?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, male abductees don't usually report this. And everything she says so far is textbook down to the last detail, except for one.

speaker: WALLACE
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: Two skeletons we found were identified as yours and Angie's? I don't understand that. It doesn't make sense to me.

speaker: WALLACE
line: Maybe they're like the cattle mutilations you hear about. Maybe they're somehow related. Maybe they're part of their tests.

speaker: MULDER
line: I had that thought but there's no precedent for it. It's in none of the literature.

speaker: WALLACE
line: Well, they didn't want anybody to find us. I guess they didn't want you to know the truth.

speaker: MULDER
line: We got to get out of here right now.

speaker: WALLACE
line: Oh, no way.

speaker: ANGELA
line: They're out there. They're always watching.

speaker: WALLACE
line: If they find us, if we leave, they'll take us again.

speaker: MULDER
line: We're leaving now. Gather your things. Angie, I'll help you up.

speaker: ANGELA
line: They're coming. I can feel it.

speaker: ANGELA
line: They're here!

speaker: WALLACE
line: Hide! They'll take you, too! We've got to hide!

speaker: MULDER
line: No!

speaker: WALLACE
line: No!

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder. Why the hell did you leave North Carolina without telling me?

speaker: MULDER
line: Long story.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You disappear and then I get a furtive call that you're back here in D.C.?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sorry. Does anybody know you're here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, this is...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Angela... and Wallace Schiff. But, Mulder, it can't be.

speaker: MULDER
line: This is my partner, Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I I.D.'d their remains myself.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, I think you were meant to.

speaker: ANGELA
line: Agent Scully, the aliens planted decoys so you would think we were dead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The aliens?

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, I want you to... put aside your scientific bias for a moment. 'Cause what I'm about to tell you is going to change your life forever. Your life, my life the life of everybody on this planet.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder...

speaker: MULDER
line: I was out there... and I found it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: The truth. This couple... they were abducted by a UFO-- the Brown Mountain lights.

speaker: ANGELA
line: They took me to a white place. There were men there. They put an implant in my neck.

speaker: MULDER
line: Just like what happened to you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, from what very little I understand about this case, this is not what happened to me.

speaker: MULDER
line: There's more.

speaker: MULDER
line: It doesn't like the light.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who?

speaker: MULDER
line: I abducted him. It's a gray. It speaks to me. We communicate telepathically. He told me everything.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I... I can hear him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, my god.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I, uh... I don't know what to say, Mulder. Where to begin. I mean, you... you were right. All these years, you were right.

speaker: MULDER
line: You think so?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You were right about the grays, about... about the abductions, about the UFOs... the lights, the Brown Mountain lights...

speaker: MULDER
line: What about the skeletons?

speaker: SCULLY
line: They were... they were fake. They were decoys.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're buying that decoy theory? What about that organic substance we found on the skeletons? That goo you were so interested in?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It was nothing. It was bog sludge.

speaker: MULDER
line: That, uh... doesn't sound like you, Scully. It, uh... God, I can't believe you're buying this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I'm admitting that I was wrong.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are... are you all right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: How are you feeling?

speaker: MULDER
line: Uh, this doesn't make any sense.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: These two. Their story. Their skeletons. None of it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, if I, of all people, can believe this then why can't you?

speaker: CORONER
line: Did you go inside the cave?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. I looked. It's empty. It's as if he just vanished.

speaker: CORONER
line: He's got to be around. We'll catch up to him. I know this area pretty well.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Doctor... It's more of that digestive material. Looks like it's coming up from out of the ground.

speaker: CORONER
line: Agent Scully? I got tracks going in and out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They were only going in before.

speaker: CORONER
line: Oh, I guess you missed him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How? I mean, this, this cave's not much more than a hole in the rock.

speaker: CORONER
line: Agent Scully?

speaker: CORONER
line: The courier just arrived. They brought your partner's charts.

speaker: CORONER
line: I'm sorry. I know it's difficult.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That, um... that digestive secretion that we keep finding-- could it, could it have done this to him?

speaker: CORONER
line: I'm not sure I follow.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, it's... it's chemically similar to gastric juices, right? I mean, maybe he fell in it or... may... maybe it's a product of a... of a particular vegetation that grows in the area.

speaker: CORONER
line: That... all sounds plausible, I guess except for one thing. There's no sign of it on these remains.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It was... it was on the Schiffs.

speaker: CORONER
line: I just think we need to look for the simplest explanation. The most logical.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What is the most logical explanation?

speaker: CORONER
line: I'd say we're looking at a murder-- one with ritualistic overtones. I think his body was stripped and then skeletonized. Possibly by boiling or use of an acid solution. Don't worry, Agent. We'll take care of the arrangements.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What arrangement?

speaker: CORONER
line: We'll have the remains sent on to Washington.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I appreciate the thoroughness of your report. Especially given the circumstances. It might be best if you took some time off-- a short leave. Agent?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir? You're satisfied with my conclusions in this case?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Absolutely. I take it you're not.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well... I was unable to determine a clear cause of death nor was I able to fully account for the condition of Agent Mulder's body.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You concluded he was a victim of a ritual killing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. I mean that was one possible scenario that I mentioned, but... in my mind it, it, it was the least plausible.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Not only is it plausible, it's, it's, uh... it's likely. Why are you questioning your own findings?

speaker: SCULLY
line: My role in the X-Files has always been to provide a... a rational scientific perspective to cases that would seem to defy explanation-- a counterpoint to Agent Mulder.

speaker: SKINNER
line: And you have done that. You have performed admirably.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Have I? How many X-Files has my scientific approach fully and satisfactorily explained?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Your reports have consistently made sense of his conclusions.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, this one makes no sense at all.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Are you suggesting this is anything other than a murder?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's what Agent Mulder would have thought.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You think he would have been right? Given Mulder's life work it's tempting to attribute his death to the paranormal, the unexplained, the unknown but that's simply not the case here.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You need to see this for what it is and given that, I promise you we'll get the bastard who did this.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm sorry.

speaker: BYERS
line: Agent Scully... How are you holding up?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I, uh... I still can't believe it.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Neither can we. I half expect Mulder to come knocking at that door. "Surprise."

speaker: FROHIKE
line: This will dull the pain.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, thank you.

speaker: BYERS
line: Just so you know... we've launched our own investigation.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was beginning to think that I was the only one who was a little suspicious.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: We'll find him. We'll find him, and we'll make him pay.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Find who?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: The son of a bitch who killed Mulder.

speaker: BYERS
line: I hope you're not offended but we, uh, managed to get ahold of your report. I must say, we were impressed by the thoroughness of it.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Especially given the circumstances.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't understand.

speaker: BYERS
line: We concur with your findings. Clearly, this was a ritualistic murder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Those were not my findings. You guys believe that, too-- that Mulder was murdered?

speaker: LANGLY
line: It's the obvious answer.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, it is not the obvious answer!

speaker: BYERS
line: We believe his body was stripped then skeletonized, possibly by boiling or the use of an acid solution.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: We'll make that monkey pay.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What the hell is wrong with everybody?! You guys, there are unanswered questions here! Am I the only one that's asking them?!

speaker: FROHIKE
line: I could use a drink.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You three, of all people! You should be all over this, not buying the party line. Look, something else is going on here. Am I the only one who thinks that?!

speaker: BYERS
line: Are you all right?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I think you need to go home and get some rest. I'll call you a cab.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What have you done with him?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Scully, you're emotionally distraught. You need to calm down and get some rest.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where is Mulder? Where is he? What have you done with him?!

speaker: SKINNER
line: Listen to me. He's gone. You need to accept that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, something else is going on here! Where is he?! Where's Mulder?!

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully.

speaker: MULDER
line: We were in the cave when the light came. It was a blinding blue-white light. Then they took me. I was abducted. I found myself in some kind of medical bay. It was white, featureless. It was just as the Schiffs had described it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, the Schiffs are dead.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, actually, they're not.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, their remains were discovered in a field. That's... that's what brought us to this case in the first place. I found your remains in that same field.

speaker: MULDER
line: Look at me. I'm here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How did you get here?

speaker: MULDER
line: Aliens brought me back here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: From North Carolina direct to your apartment door? Mulder, you don't remember getting here, do you? Neither do I.

speaker: MULDER
line: It doesn't change what happened.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, why did you knock? This is your apartment. And you don't seem the least bit surprised to find me here. And what about the Schiffs? I mean, if they're alive, as you say, then... then where are they? Where'd they go? Mulder, five minutes ago... this room was filled with people attending your wake.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, what can I say, Scully? I'm here. I'm real.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, this is not reality. This is a hallucination. It has to be. And either I am having it, or you are having it or we are having it together.

speaker: MULDER
line: Brought on by what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Something that we found in that field, Mulder, because that's where it began. Wild mushroom. Wild mushrooms, Mulder. They were growing there. I stepped on one, and it gave off spores. Several varieties of … of mushrooms are known for their hallucinogenic properties. If … if we inhaled it...

speaker: MULDER
line: Whatever happened to the most logical explanation?

speaker: SCULLY
line: This is it, Mulder. What if we're still there? If we're still in that cave in North Carolina-- that we're not here in this apartment right now?

speaker: MULDER
line: Whoa, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, Mulder, bear with me. I think this is making sense. I think that Angela and Wallace Schiff were digested by that substance that I found all over that field. That they were dissolved and then expelled up out of the ground. What if that substance and this hallucinogen are - are from one and the same organism?

speaker: MULDER
line: A giant mushroom?

speaker: SCULLY
line: A giant fungal organism, Mulder. We already know that they exist. Biologists have found specimens that range dozens of acres that weigh hundreds of tons. And what if this one needs to feed on living tissue, Mulder? There is carnivorous plant life. There's … there's the Venus Flytrap and the pitcher plant. Mulder, what if this one puts off an hallucinogen...

speaker: MULDER
line: To lure its prey into the cave?

speaker: SCULLY
line: To make it complacent. To keep it still while it devours it.

speaker: (CUT QUICKLY TO
line: MULDER, underground, covered in yellow goo.)

speaker: SCULLY
line: What if we're still underground, Mulder? What if we're moving deeper into the cave? Or being moved? Mulder, what if we're being digested? Right now.

speaker: SKINNER
line: The exact size of this organism has yet to be determined?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's correct, sir. We know that the organism extends for at least ten acres. Though it's mostly subterranean so it may be far larger.

speaker: MULDER
line: We've contacted Fish and Wildlife. We've contacted the North Carolina State Health Department as well as the local FBI field office in Raleigh. And we've contacted a mycologist at the Smithsonian for good measure. We think we have our bases covered.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The lab results determined that the spores we were exposed to have a chemical structure similar to LSD. They also contain an alkaloid which induces a state of narcosis.

speaker: SKINNER
line: It's a rare day when the two of you sign off on the same report.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm just thinking... I'm not exactly clear on how we escaped.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What's not clear?

speaker: MULDER
line: Once you recognized that we were under a chemical influence then it simply kind of... broke its spell?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's right.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, how could we simply will ourselves out of a chemical hallucination?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, the fact remains we did.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did we? Can you name me one drug that loses its effect once the user realizes it's in his system?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I assume the effects wore off to the point that you were both able to make your escape.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, how long were we underground? Hours? Half a day? How come our bodies don't show any effects of being burned by the digestive fluids? We were covered in hydrochloric acid. Yet look at our skin. Nothing.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Mulder, where are you going with this?

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully... we never escaped. We're still trapped underground.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, we did escape. I think you're suffering from post-traumatic stress.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I'm not. This is not real. You, you're not real.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I...

speaker: MULDER
line: I'll prove it, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder!

speaker: SKINNER
line: Over here! Over here!

speaker: PULSE FINDING AGENT
line: He's alive.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Hurry up! Get him out! Get him out! Keep digging! She's down here! Pull her up. Get her out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mushroom.

speaker: MUSHROOM FINDING AGENT
line: We found it. Just take it easy, Agent.
